intro: Microlicia ganevii, commonly known as the Ganev's microlicia, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the Rhamnaceae family. It is native to specific regions in South America, particularly in parts of Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom during the dry season. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Microlicia ganevii is considered a species of conservation concern.
